flawed_nl_solution:
Tony and Dean together read 23 + 12 = <<23+12=30>>30 books
3 of these books were duplicates so Tony and Dean together read 30 - 3 = <<30-3=27>>27 unique books
All three read 27 + 17 = <<27+17=44>>44 books
Because the books are being counted three times, the book is counted 3 - 1 = <<3-1=2>>2 extra times.
All together they have read 44 - 2 = <<44-2=42>>42 different books
#### 42

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 35, not 30. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
